oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Control of potato late blight by caraway oil in organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Keskitalo, M.
Fabritius, A.-L.
Hakala, K.
Hannukkala, A.
Ketoja, E.
Lehtinen, A.
Mikkonen, P.
Vuorema, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Caraway (Carum carvi) seeds contain biologically active essential oils, which have shown potential in controlling Phytophthora infestans (P.i.). An attempt is being made to develop a P.i. control strategy for organic farming based on caraway oil.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Keskitalo, M.; Fabritius, A.-L.; Hakala, K.; Hannukkala, A.; Ketoja, E.; Lehtinen, A.; Mikkonen, P. and Vuorema, A. (2005) Control of potato late blight by caraway oil in organic farming. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 1 (1), pp. 77-79.
